description: Akragas/Agrigentum was an ancient city of Sicily and is now known as Agrigento. The Archaeological Area of Agrigento was inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997.

names.description: A toponym used by Pliny the Elder.
names.details: Pliny the Elder identifies Akragas as an "oppidum" and indicates that the toponym variant "Agragas" is an earlier rendering of the city's name.

references.formattedCitation: BTCGI III, 66-128

names.details: The city of Agrigento was called Girgenti from Norman times to 1929, when it officially received its current name.
